info.description: Can you be voted the zoo's star exhibit?
info.helpText: Have all players take a seat and then click the Setup button to select the appropriate board and set it up for the number of players, and to also distribute random animals to the players. Laurels you collect should be placed in your hand (bottom of the screen) and only revealed to other players at game end.
info.ruleText:
Earn laurels as you negotiate your animals into the Star Exhibit. The game ends immediately when the Star Exhibit is filled. Amongst players who have at least one animal in the Star Exhibit, the player with the most laurels wins the game.

On your turn, either:
1. Add an animal to one of the four exhibits at the bottom of the board.
2. Advance one of your animals along the zookeeper's path or from an exhibit where you have majority (based on the full size of the enclosure) agreement. (Peacocks may be bribed to vote for you, if you pay to the bank one 2+-value laurel token for each.) Collect any non-zookeeper-covered laurel passed and replace it from the supply. Any player other than you that voted for you receives a 1-value laurel in exchange.
3. Advance a peacock and collect a 1-value laurel.
4. Move the zookeeper to cover any laurel token on the board.

Players may negotiate at any time for laurels in exchange from one another and for promises on actions this turn or in future.

OPTIONAL VARIANT - ANIMAL SPECIAL POWERS:
When playing with this variant, each player has a special power which may be used twice per game.

Special powers are never used by the player themselves, but instead are gifted to another player who uses them, usually as part of a negotiation between players. Each use of a special power token allows the ability to be used a single time.

If the special power token on the player mat is marked with a number of wreath symbols, then the player draws this many 1-value laurels each time that another player uses their special power.

Armadillo: Allow an animal to advance through a tunnel without majority support
Crocodile: Allow an animal to advance again after entering a 1-space exhibit
Hyena: Allow an additional action to move the zookeeper
Ibis: Allow a moving animal to enter a full exhibit
Monkey: Allow a moving animal to collect a different laurel on the board
Rhino: Allow a moving animal to move any second animal along with it
Tiger: Allow an animal moving over the zookeeper to collect the laurel

clickRoutine.note: Check that the user really wants to set up a fresh game

fields.text: Are you sure that you want to erase any progress and start a new game?

clickRoutine.note: Recall the animal playmats
Shuffle the animal playmats
Recall the laurel tokens
Make a separate pile of 1-value laurels 1/2
Make a separate pile of 1-value laurels 2/2
Shuffle the laurel tokens
Return the peacocks to their holder 1/2
Return the peacocks to their holder 2/2
Get player count 1/3: select all player seats
Get player count 2/3: filter out empty seats
Get player count 3/3: now count the seats
Distribute starting playmats and laurels

loopRoutine.note: Check if a player is seated

thenRoutine.note: Give the player an animal playmat

clickRoutine.note: Set a random player as start player
Use the appropriate board for the player count

thenRoutine.note: 6-7 player game: select the 3-5 player board...
...and move it outside of the player area

elseRoutine.note: 3-5 player game: select the 6-7 player board...
...and move it outside of the player area

clickRoutine.note: Place peacocks for a 3-player game
Place peacocks for a 4-player game
Place peacocks for a 5-player game
Place peacocks for a 6-player game
Place peacocks for a 7-player game
